Token.Abstract: A subclass of UIActivity that presents a single third-party application capable of opening a given URL scheme or set of URL schemes.
The name of the app, to be displayed as the UIActivity activityTitle field.
The name of the app, to be displayed as the UIActivity activityTitle field.
The name of the app, to be displayed as the UIActivity activityTitle field.
A dictionary of URL schemes an application responds to. The keys are command names, and the arguments are handlebar-templated strings that can be used to construct a valid URL.
A dictionary of URL schemes an application responds to. The keys are command names, and the arguments are handlebar-templated strings that can be used to construct a valid URL.
A dictionary of URL schemes an application responds to. The keys are command names, and the arguments are handlebar-templated strings that can be used to construct a valid URL.

Parameter.Name: dict
Parameter.Abstract: The dictionary mapping commands to valid URL schemes for the third-party application.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the third-party application.

Parameter.Name: application
Parameter.Abstract: The UIApplication to use when calling [UIApplication openURL:] and [UIApplication canOpenURL:]. You probably want this to be [UIApplication sharedApplication], but it is injected here for test purposes.

Token.Abstract: Checks whether or not the third-party app can accept a custom URL corresponding to a given command

Parameter.Name: command
Parameter.Abstract: A command to perform. If the third-party app knows how to perform this command, it should have a corresponding key in the activity's dict property.

Parameter.Name: args
Parameter.Abstract: A dictionary of arguments whose keys correspond to templating variable names in the activity's dict value for the given command.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the third-party app responds to a custom URL scheme to perform the corresponding command.
